name: Octane
description: The Octane is one of the most popular cars in Rocket League. Known for its balanced hitbox and versatility, it is favored by many professional players.
cons: Not the fastest car
Slightly weaker hitbox in certain situations

name: Dominus
description: The Dominus is a flat, sleek car that is great for flicks and dribbles, often chosen by players who prefer a more control-oriented playstyle.
pros: Wide hitbox for precise ball control
cons: Can be hard to control in tight situations
Slower aerial mobility

name: Batmobile
description: The Batmobile is a long car with a low profile, providing excellent stability and control. It's perfect for fast and smooth ground play.
pros: Low profile for easier ball control
cons: Awkward in aerials
Limited mobility compared to other cars

name: Fennec
description: The Fennec is a boxy car with a similar hitbox to the Octane. It's popular for its tight turns and ability to make precise hits.
pros: Great for quick turns and accurate shots
cons: Slower than some other cars in terms of speed
May feel clunky for some players

name: Endo
description: The Endo features a low and wide profile, making it ideal for precise control and solid dribbling. Itâ€™s especially effective in tight spaces.
pros: Great for control in tight spaces
cons: Lack of speed compared to other cars
Not as agile in aerials

name: Takumi
description: The Takumi is a car with a unique design and a balanced hitbox, offering good control and versatility for players who enjoy both aerial and ground play.
pros: Good control on both ground and aerial
cons: Slow compared to other cars
Not ideal for speed-focused playstyles

name: Mantis
description: The Mantis is a sleek and unique car with great speed and turning radius, making it ideal for quick movements and aerial shots.
cons: Awkward hitbox for ground play
Not the most stable in tight situations

name: Zippy
description: The Zippy is a small, fast car with an extremely high top speed. It excels in quick movements but sacrifices control in certain situations.
cons: Lack of control at high speeds
Difficult to handle in aerials

name: Hotshot
description: The Hotshot is a fast, aggressive car that excels in attacking situations. It's known for its high speed and maneuverability.
cons: Poor control in tight spaces
Limited aerial ability

name: Road Hog
description: The Road Hog is a bulky car with great power and strength. It excels at bumping and physical play, making it a great option for demolition-focused strategies.
cons: Slow and clunky
Hard to maneuver in tight spots

name: Merc
description: The Merc is a large and slow vehicle with a unique hitbox. It's best known for its durability and strong presence in physical plays.
cons: Extremely slow
Limited agility and aerial ability

name: Jager 619
description: The Jager 619 is a sleek, sporty car that offers good control and speed, making it ideal for players who prefer a mix of ground and aerial play.
pros: Solid in both ground and aerial
cons: Can be hard to control at high speeds
Larger hitbox in comparison to others

name: Nimbus
description: The Nimbus is a stylish car with a smooth design, perfect for fast plays and strong aerial shots.
cons: Not as good for dribbling
Limited control at ground level

name: Paladin
description: The Paladin is a unique car with a solid hitbox and great aerial control, favored by players who specialize in high-flying gameplay.
cons: Not as fast on the ground
Can be awkward for certain ground plays

name: Back Fire
description: The Backfire is an odd looking car with a unique hitbox, favored by players who specialize in hot-wheels.
cons: Not as fast on the ground
Can be awkward for certain ground plays
